information: The maximum number of points is 100. Those are the cross-code-review and cross-check criterias:

criteria.text: Eslint is set up, when lint command is run it doesn't produce any errors (if there are warnings score might be less)
Prettier is set up, format:fix command fixes issues
Husky is set up, linting is run on pre-commit

Page is split into 2 sections, top one has Search input and 'Search' button, main section displays the list of results from the selected api when page is opened for the first time (loader should be shown while app makes a call to the api)
When user types something to the Search input and clicks 'Search' button, a loader is displayed and the list is changed according to the response results for a provided search term

The search term typed into the Search input is saved in the LS when user clicks on 'Search' button (check it by closing the tab and open the app in the new one - the initial call should contain previously entered search term)
Application is wrapped with ErrorBoundary, which logs error to a console and shows a fallback UI. There should be a button to throw an error
eslint-plugin-react-compiler isn't used or isn't configured to throw errors
Direct DOM manipulations inside the React components
React hooks are used to get access to either state or to the component lifecycle
Presence of code smells (God-object, chunks of duplicate code), commented code sections
Usage of Redux or other state management libraries
Usage of component libraries, e.g. Material UI, Ant Design
Pull Request doesn't follow guideline (including checkboxes in Score) PR example
